rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_001
rows.name:
[ST:icon p1=anal ]: Move

[ST:icon p1=analp ]: Toggle Sprint

[ST:icon p1=zr ]: Jump

[ST:icon p1=anar ]: Adjust Camera

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_002
rows.name: [ST:icon p1=pls ]: Main Menu

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_003
rows.name:
[ST:icon p1=l ]+[ST:icon p1=anar ]: Zoom Camera In/Out

[ST:icon p1=crsu ]: Toggle Auto-camera

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_004
rows.name: [ST:icon p1=r ]+[ST:icon p1=crsu ]: Launch Aerial Cam

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_005
rows.name: [ST:icon p1=r ]+[ST:icon p1=crsd ]: Adjust Mini-map Zoom

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_006
rows.name: [ST:icon p1=r ]+[ST:icon p1=b ]: Toggle Auto-run

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_007
rows.name: [ST:icon p1=r ]+[ST:icon p1=x ]: Launch Navigation Ball

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_008
rows.name:
[ST:icon p1=zl ]: Board/Exit Doll

[ST:icon p1=analp ]: Toggle Doll Mode Change

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_009
rows.name: [ST:icon p1=zr ] Mid-jump: Flight

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_010
rows.name:
[ST:icon p1=zr ]: Ascend

[ST:icon p1=zl ]: Descend

[ST:icon p1=analp ] in Flight: Boost

[ST:icon p1=zl ]+[ST:icon p1=zr ] in Flight: Free Fall

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_011
rows.name:
[ST:icon p1=b ] in Flight or Mid-jump: Cruise Mode
[ST:icon p1=anal ]: Move
[ST:icon p1=zl ]: Decelerate
[ST:icon p1=a ]: Rolling Dash
[ST:icon p1=crsu ]: Toggle Cockpit View

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_012
rows.name:
Approach Target to Auto-attack

[ST:icon p1=crslr ]: Select Art

[ST:icon p1=a ]: Use Art

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_013
rows.name:
[ST:icon p1=x ]: Switch Weapon (Melee/Ranged)

[ST:icon p1=r ]: Switch Target

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_014
rows.name: [ST:icon p1=a ] in Center of Arts Palette: Overclock

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_015
rows.name:
[ST:icon p1=y ] While Selecting Art on Cooldown:
Quick Cooldown

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_016
rows.name: [ST:icon p1=r ]+[ST:icon p1=y ]/[ST:icon p1=a ]: Select Target Appendage

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_017
rows.name:
You can check the game's controls in
Main Menu > System > Control Guide.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_018
rows.name:
Succeeding in a Soul Challenge
prompt will restore HP for the team
and increase morale by one level.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_019
rows.name:
Use the highlighted Art to complete
a Soul Voice prompt. Doing so will
restore some HP and raise your
affinity with the ally.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_020
rows.name:
When you're out of range and can't
use Arts, try closing the distance to
your enemy.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_021
rows.name:
Reviving your allies:
Approach, then [ST:icon p1=a ] (costs 3000 TP)

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_022
rows.name:
HP can be restored by completing
Soul Challenges, using support Arts
with healing effects, and more.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_023
rows.name:
When an enemy is under the effects of
the Stagger status, use an Art with the
Topple effect for a high chance to send
them sprawling to the ground, giving
you a chance to deal major damage.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_024
rows.name:
Stacking multiple buffs or debuffs of
the same effect at the same level will
sometimes increase the effect's level.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_025
rows.name:
During Dense Fog weather: accuracy
and critical chance will be reduced.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_026
rows.name:
During Rain weather: beam attack
power and critical chance will be
reduced.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_027
rows.name:
During Heavy Rain weather: ranged
accuracy, beam attack power, and
critical chance will be reduced.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_028
rows.name:
During Heat Wave weather: ranged
accuracy and melee attack will be
reduced, while thermal attack will be
increased.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_029
rows.name:
During Sandstorm weather: accuracy,
ranged attack, and beam attack power
will be reduced.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_030
rows.name:
During Thunderstorm weather:
ranged accuracy and beam attack
power will be reduced, while electric
attack will be increased.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_031
rows.name:
During Electromagnetic Storm weather:
you'll take constant damage, ranged
accuracy and attack will be reduced,
while electric attack will be increased.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_032
rows.name:
During Rising Energy Mist weather:
potential will be reduced, while ether
attack will be increased and Doll fuel
will regenerate steadily.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_033
rows.name:
During Energy Mist weather: potential
will be reduced, while ether attack
will be increased and Doll fuel will
regenerate steadily.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_034
rows.name:
During Brimstone Rain weather: you'll
take constant damage, ranged
accuracy and melee attack will be
reduced, while thermal attack will be
increased.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_035
rows.name:
During Aurora weather: critical chance,
potential, and ether attack will be
increased.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_036
rows.name:
During Crimson Aurora weather:
critical chance, potential, ether attack,
and gravity attack will be increased.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_037
rows.name:
During Spore weather: melee attack,
ranged attack, and potential will be
reduced.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_038
rows.name:
During Meteor Shower weather:
critical chance and gravity attack
will be increased.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_039
rows.name:
During Rainbow weather: critical
chance and potential will be increased.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_040
rows.name:
When the player avatar reaches
maximum rank in their current class,
you'll be able to change their class
to a more advanced one.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_042
rows.name:
You can swap and strengthen Arts
by going to Main Menu > Party >
Arts.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_043
rows.name:
You can swap and strengthen Skills
by going to Main Menu > Party >
Skills.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_044
rows.name:
You can top up your Dolls' fuel
reserves by interacting with the
console in the BLADE barracks,
then selecting Barracks Hangar.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_045
rows.name:
Install a data probe at a FrontierNET
probe site to reveal segment recon
information about adjacent segments
and unlock the site for fast travel.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_046
rows.name:
If you destroy an enemy's appendage,
you will stop them from using Arts that
were dependent on that appendage.
Some materials can only be obtained
by destroying appendages.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_047
rows.name:
You can check segment recon status by
going to Main Menu > Map > Segments.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_048
rows.name:
You can access FrontierNET from one
of the consoles on the White Whale 2's
bridge.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_049
rows.name:
Install data probes at FrontierNET
probe sites and complete segment
recon to raise the survey rate.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_050
rows.name:
You can check the survey rate
by going to Main Menu > Map >
Segments.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_051
rows.name:
Speaking to characters with
a question mark above their heads
will trigger a normal mission.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_052
rows.name:
You can accept basic missions by
interacting with the Quest Board
board.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_053
rows.name:
Completing affinity missions lets you
add new allies to your team or learn
new Arts.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_054
rows.name:
You can fast travel to your Doll's
location by going to Main Menu >
Party > Return to Doll.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_055
rows.name:
You can change the members of
your team by going to Main Menu >
Active Members.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_056
rows.name:
Your affinity with your teammates will
gradually grow as you fight battles and
complete missions together.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_057
rows.name:
Collecting FrontierNET revenue is
a way of earning money, miranium,
and rare resources.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_058
rows.name:
To earn more rewards from BLADEs
you scout, train them up before you
send them back.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_059
rows.name:
Squad tasks grant a small number
of material tickets every time you
complete one. Complete all tasks to
receive a lot more of them as a bonus.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_060
rows.name:
You can trade material tickets for
enemy materials by going to
Main Menu > Online > Rewards >
Material Market.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_061
rows.name:
Gear dropped by defeated enemies
may come with random effects and
augment slots.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_062
rows.name:
To battle Global Nemeses,
use the Network Console in
the BLADE barracks.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_063
rows.name:
When fighting against giant enemies,
it is advantageous to use Dolls.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_064
rows.name:
When using Overclock, Arts can reach
a state beyond secondary cooldown
called tertiary cooldown, even further
increasing their effects.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_065
rows.name:
TP (tension points) typically accrue
when using auto-attacks and some
Arts, and when achieving a Perfect
in Soul Challenges.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_066
rows.name:
Arts using the weapon you currently
have out will continue to charge even
after they're usable until they reach
secondary cooldown, increasing their
effects.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_067
rows.name:
When you have an objective set as
your navigation target, you can press
[ST:icon p1=r ]+[ST:icon p1=x ] to launch the Navigation Ball,
showing you a path to your goal.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_068
rows.name:
If you ever need to check your
surroundings, you can press [ST:icon p1=r ]+[ST:icon p1=crsu ]
to deploy the Aerial Cam.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_069
rows.name:
When selecting an Art on cooldown,
press [ST:icon p1=y ] to use Quick Cooldown,
making the Art ready to use instantly.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_070
rows.name:
Using offensive Arts during Overclock
will raise the Overclock counter based
on the number of hits. The higher the
counter, the stronger the counter bonus
deployed when using Arts.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_071
rows.name:
Arts which currently meet the conditions
for special effects will be highlighted
with an exclamation mark icon on the
Arts Palette.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_072
rows.name:
When you use Arts while driving a Doll,
there's a chance for Cockpit Time to
trigger. When it does, all Arts will be
fully recharged, and you'll be granted
temporary invincibility.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_073
rows.name:
During Overclock, using offensive Arts
of different types in sequence (e.g.
using a yellow ranged Art followed by
an orange melee Art) will not increase
the counter. Use debuff (purple) or buff
(green) Arts between different types of
offensive Arts to build up the counter.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_074
rows.name:
Overclock will end when the timer
reaches zero. The timer can be
extended through the counter bonus
effect gained when using green or
blue Arts.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_075
rows.name:
[ST:icon p1=r ]: Target Enemy

[ST:icon p1=a ] While Targeting: Draw Weapon

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_076
rows.name:
Press [ST:icon p1=anarp ] while highlighting a segment
in Main Menu > Map > Segments to
display a segment marker, highlighting
the segment's borders on the mini-map.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_077
rows.name:
Press [ST:icon p1=zl ]+[ST:icon p1=zr ] to grapple a staggered
enemy and bind them using your Doll.
All attacks against a bound enemy will
hit, and it will take increased damage.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_078
rows.name:
If one of your Doll's weapons
(appendages) is destroyed, you will
lose access to attacks using that
weapon. Destroyed appendages will
be automatically repaired once the
battle concludes.

rows.label: HINT_CONTENT_079
rows.name:
Attacking certain enemy appendages
can deal more or less damage than
normal. Target appendages using
[ST:icon p1=r ]+[ST:icon p1=y ] or [ST:icon p1=a ].
